The claim is supported by Rep: Kionne McGhee, the bill's sponsor, who referred to a mural in the House chamber that depicts a slave woman holding a bushel of cotton near Andrew Jackson, suggesting the presence of slaves during the construction of the Old Capitol.
The claim is also supported by the infor: which states that the Old Capitol was "built in part" by enslaved people.
The Florida Capitol Complex: which includes the Old Capitol, was completed in 1845, just before Florida was admitted as the 27th state, further supporting the claim that slaves were involved in its construction.
